results.title: Getting Started with Development
results.excerpt: This page contains essential information for new developers joining the team. It covers setup instructions, coding standards, and development workflow.
results.author: john.doe@company.com
results.content:
# Getting Started with Development

Welcome to the engineering team! This guide will help you set up your development environment.

## Prerequisites
- Python 3.12
- Docker
- Git

## Setup Steps
1. Clone the repository
2. Install dependencies
3. Configure environment variables
4. Run tests

## Coding Standards
We follow PEP 8 for Python code and use automated linting tools.

results.title: API Documentation
results.excerpt: Comprehensive API documentation for all microservices including authentication, rate limiting, and error handling.
results.author: jane.smith@company.com
results.content:
# API Documentation

## Authentication
All API calls require Bearer token authentication.

## Rate Limiting
- 1000 requests per hour for authenticated users
- 100 requests per hour for unauthenticated users

## Error Handling
APIs return standardized error responses with appropriate HTTP status codes.

## Endpoints
### /api/v1/search
- Method: POST
- Description: Search across all data sources

results.title: Deployment Guide
results.excerpt: Step-by-step deployment procedures for production environment including rollback strategies and monitoring setup.
results.author: ops.team@company.com
results.content:
# Deployment Guide

## Production Deployment
1. Create feature branch
2. Run full test suite
3. Deploy to staging
4. Perform smoke tests
5. Deploy to production
6. Monitor metrics

## Rollback Procedure
In case of issues:
1. Immediate rollback using blue-green deployment
2. Investigate root cause
3. Fix and redeploy

## Monitoring
- Application metrics via Prometheus
- Logs aggregated in ELK stack
- Alerts configured for critical errors
